answers.answer: Hi there!I would suggest getting the values repeated at a lab and if these still remain low, you could modify your diet to slightly increased carbohydrate intake. If this does not seem to help I would suggest consulting an endocrinologist to check the hormonal status and for appropriate management.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: I have what used to be called pre-diabetes. I've been at this level for a number of years. In the past two weeks, my sugars have been on the lower side of normal. One morning, my fasting blood sugar was 55. Tonight three hours after a meal, it was just 91. Should I be concerned?
title: Low-Normal Glucose Levels
